Resolved Question Show me another » Quick high calorie meals? I'm trying to gain weight, since I'm dramatically under weight. My doctor said I need to gain weight soon. So what are some quick and easy meals that have high calories? 3 years ago Report Abuse by murmurin... Member since: March 06, 2008 Total points: 6,583 (Level 5) Add Contact Block
Best Answer - Chosen by Asker Rather than going for high fat content, I recommend high carbohydrates and increasing ("healthy") fat consumption only slightly. I'm also trying to put on weight (although only three or four kilos) as I'm a bit on the thin side and we're in flu season here. I'm concerned about eating lots of fats and having this effect my cholesterol etc as thin does not equal healthy! Try eating a lot of pasta and potatoes, and add a little extra fat where you can. For snacks: Cut a slit in the top of a medium sized potato, microwave on high for seven minutes. Fill the potato with cheese, add olives if you wish, season with black pepper. Crusty bread with pate and creamy cheeses. Peanut butter on toast. Half an avocado with frozen shrimp and black pepper.
For meals: pasta with tomato-based sauce and ground beef (fry meat with onions, add a tin of tomatoes, some herbs, salt, pepper, stir until heated through) curry and rice - cook meat of your choice in a large frying pan with onions and mushrooms, add one tin of coconut cream, ginger, coriander, cumin to taste, plus one tin of tomatoes, heat until reduced slightly.
Try to slightly larger portions than you normally would, and more often than you usually do, but don't eat so much that you feel ill! Once you start to eat more, your metabolism and appetite should both increase (this is a good thing!)
It also helps to take back some of those"thin"choices and reverse them - add a little extra cheese to meals and snacks, drink whole milk instead of trim,"real"coke instead of diet, have olive oil on salads instead of just vinegar etc. 3 years ago Report Abuse Asker's Rating: Asker's Comment: Thanks a lot. :) Action Bar: 0 stars - mark this as Interesting! Member since: October 16, 2008 Total points: 28,257 (Level 7) Add Contact Block === Beefy, Cheesy and Pasta in a Pot
1 (16 ounce) package elbow macaroni 1 1/2 pounds ground beef 1 tablespoon vegetable oil 1 large onion, chopped 2 cloves garlic, chopped 1 (14 ounce) can stewed tomatoes, undrained 1 (16 ounce) jar spaghetti sauce 1 (12 ounce) can mushroom stems and pieces, undrained 2 cups sour cream 1 pound Colby-Monterey Jack cheese, shredded
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain. Place ground beef in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium high heat until evenly brown and crumbled. Drain, excess fat, and set aside. Heat oil in a large heavy skillet over medium heat. Saute onion until soft and translucent. Stir in garlic, and cook for 30 seconds. Add cooked beef, tomatoes, spaghetti sauce and mushrooms; bring to a boil. Reduce heat, and simmer 20 minutes. In a 9x13 inch casserole dish, layer 1/2 of the pasta, 1/2 of the meat sauce, 1/2 of the sour cream and 1/2 of the shredded cheese. Repeat layers. Cover, and bake in preheated oven for 45 minutes. Serve with garlic bread.
===========================
Ham N Cheese Potato Bake
1 (24 ounce) package frozen O'Brien hash brown potatoes 2 cups cubed fully cooked ham 3/4 cup shredded Cheddar cheese, divided 1 small onion, chopped 2 cups sour cream 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cheddar cheese soup, undiluted 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of potato soup, undiluted 1/4 teaspoon pepper
In a large bowl, combine potatoes, ham, 1/2 cup cheese and onion. In another bowl, combine sour cream, soups and pepper; add to potato mixture and mix well. Transfer to a greased 3-qt. baking dish. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake, uncovered, at 350 degrees F for 60-65 minutes or until bubbly and potatoes are tender. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.
